entry.title: What We Are Talking About When We Talk About English Learning
entry.content: When we talk about English learning, itâ€™s all four topics as below. S,L,R,W. Of course, we all want to speak english fluently as native speakers and listenling clearly about what others are talking about. So letâ€™s carefully analyse these topics one by one. SpeakingSpeaking is important, in other words, itâ€™s our final consequence. We learn english for communicating, so speaking ability is our first needed. But speaking is the most difficult thing for us Chinese students. We live in China and our english education is short and easy,so though you graduated from college, you passed GET4 or 6, you still a new english speaker. Why?The most key reason is that we have no suitable situation to say english. Unless, you are an english teacher or you work in a cross-country company,you have to speak english to make business with your foreign customers. How to find a native english speaker to practice your english speaking?Itâ€™s hard!For example, I have registed a account from a website ExchangeLanguage,but itâ€™s not free, you have to pay some money to them,you can use their service as a gold member. I didnâ€™t pay them, I just sent some emails to those who are finding some person to exchange their language,but it doesnâ€™t work,so I quit. So, itâ€™s hard for us Chinese english learner to speaking english.But you still can find some way to practice. I find a way,maybe it sounds and looks stupid,but it works.When I am alone or Iâ€™m on the subway,I will put my earphone on and speak english to myself.I pretend I am talking with someone on the phone and in english. At first I worried about others sight,but I think too much, none would care about what you are doing and talking,you just keep your voice low,and donâ€™t make noise to borther others, itâ€™s a good way to practice speaking. Off work, I still do this practice even I am riding a bike,I talk to myself about the night,the sky is clear to see stars and the wind is soft,the weather is good and comfortable,the water on the floor,because it rained for several hours todayâ€¦ But I am not sure my accent is ok,I like British accent, but itâ€™s not easy to learn,so I am planning to find some British drama to see,itâ€™s also a nice way to learn speaking. ListeningReadingWriting

entry.title: Say something
entry.content: Sometimes I donâ€™t want to do anything, and sometimes I have a lot of ambitions, even to conquer the world. To some extent, I am not really like what I am doing.But itâ€™s hard to make changes, it costs lot. I always think about to go another city and have another life, but I always give up without moving one step. I always tell myself, I am different with others.I am the unique one! I can do anything I waht to, if I try hard!

@observable title = ''; @observable completed = false;}class todoStore { @observable todos = []; @computed get completedCount() { return this.todos.filter(todo => todo.completed).length; } @computed get totalCount() { return this.todos.length; } @action.bound toggleCompleted(id) { this.todos.forEach(todo => { if (todo.id === id) todo.completed = !todo.completed; }) } @action.bound addToDo(title) { if (!title) return alert('please input something...'); let todo = new toDo(); todo.title = title; this.todos.push(todo); }};const store = new todoStore();export { store } ToDoç»„ä»¶12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031import React, { Component } from 'react';import { observer } from "mobx-react";import { store } from '../../store'import './style.css'@observer export default class ToDo extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); } render() { const { title, id, completed } = this.props; return (<div className={`todo ${completed ? 'completed' : ''}`} onClick={() => store.toggleCompleted(id)} > {title} </div>); }}//style.css.todo{ background-color: white; text-align: center; font-size: 30px; margin: 3px;}.todo.completed{ background-color: brown;} App.js123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839import React, { Component } from 'react'import { observer } from "mobx-react";import DevTools from 'mobx-react-devtools'import ToDo from './components/ToDo'import { store } from './store'const TEXT = 'please input something...';const ToDoList = ({ todos }) => todos.map(t => <ToDo key={t.id} {...t} />);@observer export default class App extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { title: '' } } render() { const { title } = this.state; const { todos, totalCount, completedCount } = store; return (<div className="APP"> <input style={{ width: 300 }} placeholder={TEXT} value={title} onChange={e => this.setState({ title: e.currentTarget.value })} /> <button onClick={() => { store.addToDo(title); this.setState({ title: '' }); }}>Add one ToDo</button> <div>{`total count:${totalCount}`}</div> <div>{`total completed count:${completedCount}`}</div> <ToDoList todos={todos} /> <DevTools /> </div>); }} æ•ˆæœå›¾

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
